com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.android.graphics

Class WZBitmap

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.android.graphics.WZBitmap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer

    public class WZBitmap
extends Object
implements WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
    The WZBitmap class can be used to display a bitmap as an overlay on a WZCameraView by registering an instance as a frame listener using WZCameraView.registerFrameListener(WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameListener)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int BOTTOM
      A position specifier for use as the second argument to setPosition(int, int) to align the bitmap along the bottom of the display.
      static int CENTER
      A position specifier for use with setPosition(int, int) to center the bitmap within the device display.
      static int CURRENT_SIZE
      A scale specifier for use as the second argument to setScale(float, int) to scale the bitmap as a factor of the current display size
      static int FRAME_HEIGHT
      A scale specifier for use as the second argument to setScale(float, int) to scale the bitmap as a factor of the video frame height.
      static int FRAME_WIDTH
      A scale specifier for use as the second argument to setScale(float, int) to scale the bitmap as a factor of the video frame width.
      static int LEFT
      A position specifier for use as the first argument to setPosition(int, int) to align the bitmap along the left hand side of the display.
      static int ORIGINAL_SIZE
      A scale specifier for use as the second argument to setScale(float, int) to scale the bitmap as a factor of the source bitmap size
      static int RIGHT
      A position specifier for use as the first argument to setPosition(int, int) to align the bitmap along the right hand side of the display.
      static int SURFACE_HEIGHT
      Deprecated. 
      use FRAME_HEIGHT instead
      static int SURFACE_WIDTH
      Deprecated. 
      use FRAME_WIDTH instead
      static int TOP
      A position specifier for use as the second argument to setPosition(int, int) to align the bitmap along the top of the display.

      • getDisplaySize

        public WZSize getDisplaySize()
        Returns the current display size of the bitmap being rendered (i.e. with the current scale factor applied)
        Returns:
        The current size of the bitmap being displayed

      • getScaleBasis

        public int getScaleBasis()
        Returns the current method used for applying the scale factor
        Returns:
        FRAME_WIDTH, FRAME_HEIGHT, ORIGINAL_SIZE (default), or CURRENT_SIZE

      • setWidth

        public void setWidth(int width)
        Set the display width of the bitmap. The height will be adjusted to preserve the aspect ratio and the scale factor will be reset to 1.0.
        Parameters:
        width - The display width, in device pixels

      • setHeight

        public void setHeight(int height)
        Set the display height of the bitmap, The width will be adjusted to preserve the aspect ratio and the scale factor will be reset to 1.0.
        Parameters:
        height - The display height, in device pixels

      • setScale

        public void setScale(float scale)
        Set the display scale factor for the bitmap based on it's original size
        Parameters:
        scale - The scale factor

      • setScale

        public void setScale(float scale,
                     int scaleBasis)
        Set the display scale factor and scaling basis for the bitmap
        Parameters:
        scale - The scale factor
        scaleBasis - One of FRAME_WIDTH, FRAME_HEIGHT, ORIGINAL_SIZE, or CURRENT_SIZE

        Set the bitmap's display position

        position - The display position, in display pixels

        Parameters:

      • setVisible

        public void setVisible(boolean isVisible)
        Set a flag indicating whether the bitmap should be rendered (i.e. displayed) or not
        Parameters:
        isVisible - true if the bitmap should be rendered, false otherwise

      • isVisible

        public boolean isVisible()
        Indicates if the bitmap is being rendered (i.e. displayed) or not
        Returns:
        true if the bitmap is being rendered, false otherwise

      • isWZVideoFrameRendererActive

        public boolean isWZVideoFrameRendererActive()
        Description copied from interface: WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
        Indicates if the frame renderer is active or not WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer.onWZVideoFrameRendererDraw(WZGLES.EglEnv, WZSize, int) will only be called on an active renderer
        Specified by:
        isWZVideoFrameRendererActive in interface WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
        Returns:
        true is this renderer is active, false otherwise.

      • onWZVideoFrameRendererInit

        public void onWZVideoFrameRendererInit(WZGLES.EglEnv eglEnv)
        Description copied from interface: WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
        Called at the beginning of a rendering cycle
        Specified by:
        onWZVideoFrameRendererInit in interface WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
        Parameters:
        eglEnv - The current OpenGL ES environment. Note that this may be a different EglEnv than the one supplied with each call to WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer.onWZVideoFrameRendererDraw(WZGLES.EglEnv, WZSize, int). See for WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer.onWZVideoFrameRendererDraw(WZGLES.EglEnv, WZSize, int) for details.

      • onWZVideoFrameRendererDraw

        public void onWZVideoFrameRendererDraw(WZGLES.EglEnv eglEnv,
                                       WZSize frameSize,
                                       int frameRotation)
        Description copied from interface: WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
        Called to render a frame of video to the viewport for the current OpenGL ES context Note that eglEnv may differ at each call. You can assume, however, that the EGL context in each instance in between calls to WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer.onWZVideoFrameRendererInit(WZGLES.EglEnv) and WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer.onWZVideoFrameRendererRelease(WZGLES.EglEnv eglEnv) are shared contexts and can access the same EGL resources.
        Specified by:
        onWZVideoFrameRendererDraw in interface WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
        Parameters:
        eglEnv - The current OpenGL ES environment. Note that this may be a different EglEnv than the one supplied with
        frameSize - size of the video frame (pixels)
        frameRotation - frameRotation angle to apply when rendering (degrees, usually 0)

      • onWZVideoFrameRendererRelease

        public void onWZVideoFrameRendererRelease(WZGLES.EglEnv eglEnv)
        Description copied from interface: WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
        Called at the end of a rendering cycle
        Specified by:
        onWZVideoFrameRendererRelease in interface WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer
        Parameters:
        eglEnv - The current OpenGL ES environment.
